732078f-b.title: Islands - Hoffman Island - Laboratory.
732078f-b.text:
Luarantine N.Y.
July 1E, 1912.
Every precaution is being taken by the federal health officials tp prevent bubonic playe from getting into this country. Experinents of methods for preventing and fighting the dread disease are now being carried on at .uarantine, New York harbor. The picture shows doctors inoculating a guinea pig vith bubonic plague
germs.
Laboratory on Hoffman Island.
Photo-News Jepartment
American Press .Ssociation
)7a(  SOo 22S iest3Sth St., N.Y.

732079f-c.title: Islands - Hoffman Island - [Lower New York Bay.]
732079f-c.text:
Hoffman Island, in the Lower New York Bay, seen from the lower end of South Beach, at Ccean Breeze, Staten Island. -t is an artificial island constructed in 1872 by the New York State Cuarantine Service for the detention and purification of well persons arriving in infected vess-ls. In 1938 the island was reconditioned for use oy the Training School of the United States 'aritime Service, which prepares trained seamen under the supervision of the Cnited States Coast Guard.
June 16, 1925
P. L. Sperr
(2) and (3)
Two views at a later date. Cn the horizon is visible
the shore of Goney Island, Brooklyn.
August 25, 1929
P. L. Sperr
